samples.question: And which one do you think is more useful or is more needed for your leave?
samples.transcript: I think all of them are important and useful, but I think the ones related to children and the elderly are the most important ones.

samples.question: Do they also contribute to charity?

samples.question: Should charities be allowed to make a profit?
samples.transcript: They should be allowed to make a profit as long as they are actually helping society. Because we need people that dedicate their time fully to charities in order to actually help. samples.question: Do you think people are less committed to goals now than in the past?
samples.transcript: I think it depends on the people you are looking at. generally we are a bit less pressured, I would say, than our parents or even grandparents because they were really, you know, committed, in order to have jobs, in order to have opportunities. So I think that nowadays some people tend to, yeah, not really complete and fulfill their promises. But others are also seeing promises as a way to, you know, become entrepreneurs and to create new opportunities for themselves. So I guess it is half-half. Okay.

samples.question: And what is the importance of commitment at work?
samples.transcript: I think it is very important because when you are looking for someone, you always look for someone that you can trust and someone you can also rely on. And, this is part of commitment because if the boss knows that he can rely on you, then you have more, I would say, higher chances being recruited because you show this image of someone who is, definitely capable of commitment Okay And do young people show commitment towards work if they are not paid well it true maybe wages and salaries can influence the way we are committed to work for example I would say that we need to be committed no matter the amount of money we will earn in the end but maybe yes this can influence the level of commitment especially with young people some are struggling for example People with money issues. So it is an important, criteria for them. So, but I think your commitment needs to be, you know, applied no matter the salary you will receive. Okay.

samples.question: And how can we teach young children to be committed to their goals and never give up?
samples.transcript: I guess, it starts at a young age. We need to basically share with them those values. Because some people sometimes were not told about them. so having, for example, at school, this frame in which young kids can learn that being committed in the end is worth it. Because usually people, they are not committed enough because they think it will not work in the end. But if you show them that no matter what happens, it is worth it, then they will tend to be more committed in the end.
